marl noun [U]
(ROCK)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a type of rock or soil with very fine grains, often used as a fertilizer (= a substance spread on soil to make plants grow well): Higher slopes reveal widening seams of calcareous marl. This problem may be counteracted by a top-dressing of marl and compost.

marl noun [U]
(THREAD/CLOTH)
a yarn (= thread used for knitting) made by twisting different colours together: Marl is often used in knitwear. Shetland marl is a chunky yarn.
cloth with areas of different colours that do not form a regular pattern, made from marl yarn (= thread for knitting): Marl is made by combining two different coloured yarns in the thread which is used to construct the fabric. a grey marl sweatshirt
